instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3787-A no power
threads.message:
Hi, I have a 820-3787-A board that won't turn on
the customer tried to replace the battery but he mounted the flat j9510 upside down
I tried to do some measurements and the row of capacitors c9321 c9322 etc sometimes sounds short to me but not always. Green and orange light with fans stopped

threads.title: 820-3787-A no power
threads.message:
Very likely dead PCH.
It got 5V on some data lines probably...

BTW, allow 10-15s since the power is removed, before checking in ohm scale, or diode mode.

threads.title: 820-3787-A no power
threads.message:
but with pch disconnected shouldn't it turn on?
what other measurements can i do?

threads.title: 820-3787-A no power
threads.message: How, if PCH controls power on sequence???

threads.title: 820-3787-A no power
threads.message: I tried with a pch taken from another mac but same problem. as soon as I press the power button the right fan spins for a second and then stops and does not turn on

threads.title: 820-3787-A no power
threads.message:
"Green and orange light with fans stopped"
You didn't say to get fans spin before.

Check voltage on big coils, when the fans spin.

threads.title: 820-3787-A no power
threads.message:
I said that badly
sometimes not always if I press the power button the right fan starts spinning for less than a second
but it doesn't turn all the time it just hints at turning

threads.title: 820-3787-A no power
threads.message:
Check if turns on in SMC bypass mode.

You should catch pulse on some big coils; did you try?
Also test the board alone on the desk; nothing connected, no RIO board, no trackpad, nor LCD.

threads.title: 820-3787-A no power
threads.message:
smc nothing does not turn on
all big coli give me 0, a few salt for half a second but then it goes back to 0
only L7130 stays steadily at 12.5

threads.title: 820-3787-A no power
threads.message:
"a few salt for half a second"
Yeah, but which coils?
Check if ALL_SYS_PWRGD pulses at same time.
